Post Text: 5 Ways that helped me get an internship in college -Quick Backstory - I was in my 2nd year of graduation pursuing Bcom Hons from University of Delhi when I cracked my first office internship in the finance domain at Jindal Steel & Power Ltd. ⭐️1. So whenever you complete any skill building course, try to make a project out of it using real-life examples. 💡4. Post Text: “Do I need an MBA if I’ve done X/Y/Z course?” ❓This is one of the most common questions I am asked.To explain this, let’s pick a real-life example.Let’s say you want to make a career in finance/accounts. We have so many professional courses in these fields like- FRM,CFA ,CMA ,CPA ,ACCA,CFP,CAAnd many more! Until and unless you’re not explicitly doing CA, I believe you should certainly do an MBA if you’re looking for the best opportunities. 💯The point is not just the curriculum! All three levels of CFA combined will teach you more about finance than nearly any MBA in the world (MBA course has other subjects too)Your next question will be -” If I need to make a career in finance and I’m doing CFA, then why is an MBA necessary?” 🤔Because they are not substitutes but rather complementary courses. There will be things that you’ll only learn in an MBA and things only covered in professional courses. 💯TRY THIS AND GET THE RIGHT ANSWER-Search for the best MBA colleges in India on LinkedIn and go to the ‘people’ section. You’ll see that nearly 80-90% of the students pursuing their masters from the top colleges in India either have done or are doing professional courses. This gives excellent clarity on the importance of both.PRO TIP- Send them a customized message and connect with them! Why leave any chance to network with people who have the same interests? ⭐️ Nothing beats the combination of the two, but it is essential to know that the timeline can be different for different people, and you may or may not do both simultaneously. My advice is to make room for both to have the best career possible in your field.Thoughts? 💡#career #jobs #opportunities

Author: Ishaan Arora
Post Text: I travelled to 5 European countries and here are 11 interesting points 💫 -1. If you’re looking for cost-friendly places avoid countries like Switzerland and France and use metros over taxis.2. In every part of Europe, tap water is drinkable.3. Go to the toilet twice before leaving your space as majority of the toilets cost 💶1(Roughly 90 INR) to use. 4. Uber is either banned or not used in majority of the countries hence you need to rely on taxis.5. Language is a barrier especially at the local places, keep your Google translator handy.6. Egg is considered vegetarian at a lot of places. Even regular salads have either pork or beef in it. Be very specific with what you eat - my friends ate pork meatballs because someone told them it’s soya lol.7. The best exchange rate is mostly available at the ATMs.8. Majority of the destinations have public Wifi which makes life easy. You can avoid taking international packs until very necessary.9. Carry your own water, a single 1 litre water bottle can cost upto 350 INR!10. Adapters are a must! The charging portals are different than here and your regular chargers or machine wires won’t work without the adapter.11. You get free bread and Parmesan cheese at almost every restaurant. I will also be making a different post on how to travel across Europe in the most cost effective manner. ✅P.S - Picture was taken at Rome, Italy. ❤️LinkedIn for Creators #travel #networking #costofliving

Post Text: Planning to make a career in finance? ⭐️A lot of students aspire to be an investment banker, financial analyst, risk manager etc in top tier firms, but what are the courses that one needs to pursue to make a top-notch career in finance? 💡Here is the list -(Not considering MBA/CA here)1. CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) -I’ve said this time and again that CFA is without a doubt the best course in finance and can give you a massive edge in the field. It has 3 levels, usually take around 2-3 years to complete and costs around 3-3.5 lacs.2. FRM (Financial Risk Management) -Probably the second best but the most important one when it comes to the risk management field. It has 2 levels, takes around 1-1.5 years and costs around 2 lacs. It dwells into every aspect of risk management and is a must if you’re planning this side of finance.3. Financial Modeling & Valuations -What makes this course special is the practical aspect in it. When I did FRM, I got plenty of books at my home to study. Same with CFA or pretty much every course. With FMVA, it’s all done on excel and hence this makes it different from the others. A must-learn skill in the field of finance.Other mentions - In Big 4 firms if you are not planning to do CA then CPA and ACCA adds great value especially as a fresher. 👌🏻In finance - CFP, CWM, CAIA etc are also good courses but I personally rank CFA and FRM higher. A thorough research can be done on your part too to make a final call. 💯Made a video on top 5 finance courses that help you land a job. Check here - https://lnkd.in/dFRUHmpvHope it helps ❤️#finance #jobs #career

Author: Ishaan Arora
Post Text: College life can be stressful! 👀Many TV shows certainly depict a cooler side of it but in reality it is poles apart. Students struggle for a lot of things including -• Struggle of finding internships • Selecting the right courses• Choosing the right specialisationAnd a lot more! 🤯I can totally relate but here are 5 tips that really helped me -1. Live Projects -While finding internships can be daunting, doing a skill based course and then making a project around it is a lot easier. Ex - Let’s say you do a digital marketing or financial modeling course. Both are practical courses where even if you don’t get good internships you can always make your own financial model(s) or articles/pages for ads etc 🙌🏻2. Extra Curricular ActivitiesEverything that is not a part of your curriculum and extra courses is ECA.Societies, sports team, conferences, events, projects, research papers etc all can be done side by side to enhance your profile. 💯3. Doing Additional Courses -In this age and time it is a must. We can’t just rely on our college degrees anymore. Doing extra courses is the biggest advantage in a resume.Start with short-term courses and slowly get to the job oriented courses. ⭐️4. Marks Matter -Don’t let anyone influence you, marks actually matter.As a recruiter you’ll always prefer to see 90% over 70% (keeping other things constant).If you’re looking to pursue your masters or planning to go for a job - work on your numbers. 💫5. Mindset TweakThe thing that works like magic! Change how you think. Everyone around me was always planning to get ahead of the other person and do things for a better job. 🙌🏻I’d recommend you to focus on the process. Work on things that help you grow in all aspects of your life and especially improve your skills. At the end of the day nothing else matters. Don’t do things just for a better resume or jobs, get to the bottom of things and work on your knowledge - other things follow.Thoughts? ✅#career #college #jobs

Author: Ishaan Arora
Post Text: Burnout - 3 Signs and Tips to Overcome ⭐️In today’s time every one is stressed for one thing or the other. It doesn’t matter whether you are doing a job, having a startup, creating content, freelancing or anything else - you’ll be facing tough times. Many of us are good at fighting our own battles but sometimes it’s just too much! Been there myself, so here are 3 signs with which if you relate then you’re possibly burnt out - 1. Feeling Alone -You feel you have no one in this world to whom you can turn to. All the time you’re fighting your battles alone and you think even your parents or close friends don’t understand your feelings.2. Feeling low or helpless 24*7Many times we relate this to laziness but it’s not! It rather revolves around the fact that you have your 100% for way too long and now you need a break because things and even our body is not the same all the time.3. Self-Doubt and Lack of Motivation You start to question your actions even though they may not be wrong. You blame yourself for every thing and seldom find motivation for the important tasks.But how do we overcome this?1. Acceptance-Accept that you’re exhausted mentally and physically. There’s nothing wrong with it. Once you accept then only you can work on it.2. Take a break -Obviously! Invest time in activities that you love. Ex - I love to play cricket and watch shows. It can be something else for you. 3. Worship your Mind & Body -For at least 25 days, have a fixed sleep schedule, eat healthy, manage your stress and prioritise yourself over other people and things.To conclude, burnout is a phase that almost everyone faces but the catch is to identify, accept and get over it to continue the great work you have been doing. 💫LinkedIn for Creators #motivation #inspiration #work

Post Text: In the last 6 months I have met 100+ founders and 500+ creators and sharing my thoughts here now. 💡Sandesh, Riya and I are sharing our thoughts on three different topics - networking, research and growth on LinkedIn so make sure you check out all 💯Everyone wants to network isn’t it? Author: Ishaan Arora
Post Text: Will ONDC (Open Network for Digital Commerce) overpower the dominance of Amazon,Flipkart, Zomato & Swiggy? 👀Here’s all you need to know -💡Is ONDC an app? No! It’s an open network. More like the UPI for e-commerce. 💡Is it government owned? No! It’s a private non-profit section 8 company established by the DPIIT of Govt of India to develop open e-commerce.But the question is, which problems gave birth to ONDC?💡 The Monopoly & duopoly of giant tech companies.💡 The Game of data - The e-commerce platforms like Amazon and Flipkart have the access to tons of data. Analyzing the data, they know which products sell the most, at what price range, with what specs, colors, and which geographical location has the highest amount for that one category of product. Using all this data, they acquire a small manufacturing company and manufactures the exact same product with the in demand features and lists the same in less price. That’s not all! These products will be listed top in the list. This strategy does make millions of dollars for the company, but the sale tends to drop for other brands, and small brands become negligible. 💡Deep Discounting - Products listed on these platforms goes under huge discounts of up to 60-80% during the sale season, especially during festivals. Offline stores who fail to match the offers face downfall in business. The huge losses faced by the offline market was a point of concern for the government.💡Commission on Zomato & Swiggy are around 18-24% How will ONDC fill the gap?💡Discoverability - Every seller is discoverable now. You can access the products from all e-commerce platforms, even without downloading them. 💡 All the market players are listed - Aggregators, sellers, delivery companies to take care of the customer. Zomato & Swiggy had a manipulation over delivery fee & surcharge incase that location has less or no delivery partners, but here that won’t be the case because, even the delivery companies like dunzo are listed here.💡 Price Comparison tool to find the best deal without having to browse various platforms💡Commissions on this platform will remain0-3%, which will be affordable for sellers. When the capital here decreases the end prices for the customers decreases at the same time.💡Earlier restaurants did not have access to customer data, which they’ll have now via ONDC.Will ONDC really be able to solve these issues?
